data.title: Good food and beer
data.text: Went here for my sisters birthday and it was great. Our party sat in one of the train cars. It was a little tight but nice atmosphere. The food was good and drinks even better. They have a big selection of beer, almost too big. It's tough to choose. I definitely look forward to going back.

data.title: Great variety of beer
data.text: The food is very good but depending on what time you go the service can be slow and unpredictable. It is a very lively atmosphere.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: Went here for a business lunch...two of my colleague were disappointed they didn't offer Mr. Pibb or Dr. Pepper but other than that we had a pleasant enough lunch experience.

data.title: Great food and staff
data.text: My sons choice to come here to celebrate his 22nd birthday on a Saturday evening.  It was worth the drive up from Merced as the food and service were great.  He wanted the chicken and waffles appetizer to start off for the five of us, which was quite good.  My wife and I shared the pear/brie burger with garlic fries....awesome.  Others had burgers and one had pasta, everyone enjoyed their selections.  Asking our server if the bartender knows of "pickle backs" the boys in the group finished with one of these, watching the face of our son was priceless.  Then the birthday boy was given a nice dessert.  I can see why he wanted to drive up for the food,  it's very good.

data.title: Truly cool spot
data.text: We found this place during a road trip, traveling from Yosemite to San Fran. Really great atmosphere, fun bar area, and a cool railroad/train theme that wasn't overdone. The beer list was excellent, and the food was a very warmly received 4.5/5. I reserve my 5 stars for truly incredible experiences/meals, but this was nice. We had the vampire tacos which had a good spice and crispy cheese shell, the truffle Mac which was huge, and the short ribs with a great mash. Loved the staff here too!

data.title: Really really good pizza
data.text: Brought my wife here for her birthday.  Great atmosphere. Very good menu with a large selection of local brews.  Get the flight of tasters for a good beer tasting evening. The pizza is brick oven and very good. The service was attentive and outstanding. The prices are reasonable and it was slightly crowed for a Thursday night.

data.title: Love the Rotating Beer Menu
data.text: This is our go-to restaurant in Turlock-- especially on a hot day when all we want to do is have a cold beer and comfort food.  The beer list is extensive, in particular when you consider that so many are on tap.  Love the pub atmosphere, and also love the rumbling when a train goes by.  Family favorites include the black bean burger, bbq chicken salad, fire wings, pulled pork sandwich, and the pizzas.

data.title: Excellent Beer and Food Choices
data.text: I was looking to try something new when I saw 10 East Kitchen & Tap House on Tripadvisor. The beer selection is outstanding with something for every palate. The food is way above standard pub fare with some really interesting choices. The Truffle Mac and Cheese was very good. I’m looking forward to going back.

data.title: Delicious as usual
data.text: I have visited 10 East numerous times and it never disappoints. The atmosphere is great and the food is delicious each and everytime. Love their burgers! Especially the Stoneburger! Mmmm! It's so hard to decide on what to order each time I go because all of their food is delicious! Another personal favorite is The Pulled Pork Nachos.. amazing! They are also known for their craft beers but I haven't personally had a chance to try them (usually other members in my dinner party have tried and enjoyed them) The only downfall to this place is the spotty customer service at times. But overall, love this place for the great food and I look forward to my next visit.

data.title: Excellent, with a variety
data.text: I visited during a weekday around 5:15, and there was hardly anyone dining. At 6:00 it got quite a bit busier, so I was glad to have made a reservation as a "just in case." The enchilada appetizer was excellent for a non-Mexican restaurant, I was pleasantly surprised. Our meals included the meatloaf, the Asian noodles, and a Cubano on a gluten free roll. Everything was excellent and I would insist everyone in the area to eat there. There are several things on the menu that I would like to try.

data.title: Best Burgers in town
data.text: Great beer selection and awesome burgers. The total pig burger is amazing! All their food is great. It's not your typical pub food. The brunch on the weekend is a must. The only negative thing that I can think of is that the beer list changes weekly so you have to find a new favorite all the time lol.

data.title: Revamped Menu is to Die For!
data.text: The handmade brick oven rectangle pizzas are fabulous and their new menu offers something for everyone from beef, pork, chicken and vegetarian (Gardein) choices. For beer lovers they have every exotic and local brews on tap, variety of wines and even non-alcoholic for those on the wagon. Great ambience for social gatherings or dinner parties, with a couple of areas being original train cars where you can book private parties. Very unique and delicious!

data.title: You gotta try this place
data.text:
Called ahead Saturday of mothers day weekend put name in the list..got seated within 5 minutes of arriving...Jodie was a great waitress!! She was very sweet and accommodating!! 
Food was served in a timely manner and HOT!! I loved the menu! Can't wait to try several more items! I had the dubwich and it was filling and delish!!  My son had the pulled pork nachos and the bf had mojo chicken. Everything was really good! 
I can't wait to go back and try something else!!

data.title: Mediocre
data.text: I came here for a business lunch and it wasn't as good as I had expected given the fact that everyone around me goes here all the time. The full bar is nice and it makes for a nice, relaxed date night I'm sure. It was even appropriate for our business lunch. I had a hamburger and I was just not all that impressed. I'll visit it again just to make sure it wasn't a fluke thing. The customer service was great though and the decor was gorgeous.

data.title: Good downtown restaurant option.  Pub type food.
data.text: Our first choice was closed so we headed to 10 East Kitchen and Tap house.  We loved the décor - one can tell a lot of money was poured in this restored train station.  The bar area is large and was busy during lunch time.  I had a great salad.  It is called Simple salad but it was beyond simple - successful combination of ingredients.  My daughter had the truffle Mac.  I just read a review about that being too oily.  Although she did not complain about it, she did not finish it.  I could see all the oil and can relate to the previous review.  Something to be done about this otherwise great dish.  Serive was really slow.  Waiter was nice and di not charge our coke.

data.title: An Early Evening
data.text:
Whenever I visit Turlock, CA, I must visit this restaurant at least once. I truly enjoy this place. It has a true SoCal ambience and I am SoCal. I had the Thai Noodle Dish and it was excellently prepared. The spice, heat was magnificent. I complemented the food with an excellent Chardonnay wine. 

We dined at the bar area. Our server was Chris (soon to be married). He was a hoot.

data.title: Best burgers in town
data.text: The "Total Pig" burger is the best burger I've ever eaten. The brunch is amazing as well. I can honestly say I've never had a disappointing meal here. The only knock would be that they don't always have your favorite beer but they have so many others to try so it's not that big of a deal. Highly recommend 10 East.

data.title: Great bar and food delicious
data.text: We popped in just to grab a quick drink and ended up staying for another drink and additional apps.  The pot stickers were amazing!

data.title: 10 East
data.text: Unique place to meet with friends. Limited seating. Food is ok. The rumble of passing train provides a unique experience.

data.title: Great for a large group!
data.text: Got together here with family in a group of 8. We called ahead and the staff had a table all ready for us when we arrived. Wait staff was great, and the beer was excellent. Our food arrived pretty much at the same time - something that many restaurants have trouble doing with a large group. I had the Cubano. It was fine, but not the best Cuban sandwich I've had. I'm used to it being pressed and being more melted together. This one was tasty, but more like a regular toasted sandwich. The sweet potato tater tots we delicious. Also, they have several kinds of flavored fries that were yummy.
